understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named getFullQueryLogOptions which returns the full_query_logging_options from the configuration.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code provides default options for full query logging, which can be overridden from the command line when executing nodetool enablefullquerylog.

config_description: default options for full query logging - these can be overridden from command line when executing nodetool enablefullquerylog
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration code for full_query_logging_options provides default options for full query logging. When the getFullQueryLoggerOptions method is called, it checks if the logging is enabled. If enabled, it retrieves the options from the binLogOptions and returns them. If not enabled, it retrieves the options from the cassandra.yaml file.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the configuration depends on when the enableFullQueryLogger method is called with new parameters. This method is triggered when the user wants to enable full query logging with specific options.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the configuration option is significant as it determines how full query logging is handled in the system. Changing the options such as log directory, roll cycle, blocking, max log size, archive command, and max archive retries can affect the performance and storage usage of the system.
